pullRequest.title: Implement collection of min/max values in DynamicFilterSourceOperator
pullRequest.bodyText: Added a flag dynamic-filtering-min-max-values to allow fallback to collecting min and max values for dynamic filtering in replicated joins  when build side exceeds per driver max size or row count thresholds.

nodes.bodyText: nit: allocate only if minMaxValues is true?
nit: you can pre-compute channels.get(channelIndex).type. isOrderable() for all channels in the constructor.
The code seems quite similar to the one at addInput() method. Can it be refactored?

I guess that this loop can benefit from JIT compilation, especially for large blocks.
Is it possible to see whether such optimization does take place during the micro-benchmarks?
let's just keep it as Block[] that contain singletons
you can use else if here
do we need to set it here? There is no corresponding test

@@ -86,6 +87,7 @@ protected Session getSession()
         return Session.builder(super.getSession())
                 .setSystemProperty(JOIN_REORDERING_STRATEGY, NONE.name())
                 .setSystemProperty(JOIN_DISTRIBUTION_TYPE, PARTITIONED.name()) // Avoid node local DF
+                .setSystemProperty(DYNAMIC_FILTERING_MIN_MAX_VALUES, "true")

nodes.bodyText: mentioned it's for replicated joins only

nodes.bodyText: rename to collectMinMaxValues

nit: Ideally, this should make DOUBLE and REAL types not orderable, but that would break too much code.
Also, I don't think nested types work either given that they can contain double or real types inside. What would be the tuple domain if we hit NaN?
I think we should whitelist selected types that work with this feature instead.

It's not that simple as nested types (e.g row) could contain doubles too.
Let's whitelist types for which min/max optimization works (e.g numeric types, timestamps, character strings,...)
check !minMaxChannels.isEmpty() instead here and in other places
call it just domain
add a comment that collector was already notified with TupleDomain.all.
let's not make it experimental as DF is not experimental anymore
let's make maxPerDriverRowCount and maxPerDriverSize params of createOperatorFactory (with default override maybe), so that in case we increase limits in the future, the tests won't run longer
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -103,7 +113,8 @@ private OperatorFactory createOperatorFactory(DynamicFilterSourceOperator.Channe
                 this::consumePredicate,
                 Arrays.stream(buildChannels).collect(toList()),
                 getDynamicFilteringMaxPerDriverRowCount(TEST_SESSION),
-                getDynamicFilteringMaxPerDriverSize(TEST_SESSION));

rename to dynamic_filtering_min_max_limit_per_driver

nodes.bodyText: dynamic_filtering_min_max_limit_per_driver -> dynamic_filtering_range_row_limit_per_driver`
Just leave minValues == null as  in other places

commit.message: Add SQL annotation to test method

Implement collection of min/max values in DynamicFilterSourceOperator

Added a flag dynamic-filtering-range-row-limit-per-driver to allow collection of
min and max values for dynamic filtering upto a given per driver row count
when build side exceeds dynamic-filtering-max-per-driver-row-count or
dynamic-filtering-max-per-driver-size thresholds

afterCommit.message:
Implement collection of min/max values in DynamicFilterSourceOperator

Added a flag dynamic-filtering-range-row-limit-per-driver to allow collection of
min and max values for dynamic filtering upto a given per driver row count
when build side exceeds dynamic-filtering-max-per-driver-row-count or
dynamic-filtering-max-per-driver-size thresholds
